lines.text: [last lines]
Psychologically, I'm very confused, but personally I feel just wonderful.

[of his sister's children]
One of them's named for me.
Which one?

[slightly confused]
Andrew.
You're not the only one who's getting engaged. I mean, he hasn't asked me yet. And he might not, but then again...
He might. Well as a matter of fact, I happen to know it will happen.
What do you mean you know it will happen?
I might as well tell you, he came to see me the other day.
Who?
Your fiance. I had a pretty tough time with him too. You know he just didn't believe you when you wrote and told him I meant nothing to you.
I just can't rap my head around this. He came to see you?
See me, yeah. Oh, but don't worry, I straightened everything out. In a little while, you'll be Mrs. Nusspickle.
Nusspickle!
Well, yes, that's his name isn't it. I mean that's what he told me.
Mr. Larkin, what about his mind? Did you find him intellegent, witty...
Witty? No, no, not witty, but then you can't judge a man when he's out of a job.
Out of a job!
Well, yes.
He never said anything to me about that.
Well he probably didn't want to worry you. But he thinks you can both live quite comfortably on what you make.

[horrified]
Did he ask you what I make?
Well, after all, he is your fiance.
I wish you could read his letters. Then you could see he has such a lofty point of view.

[sitting close and speaking in a low voice]
Loft?

[starts to scoot away]
And now to find out he's so materialistic.

[putting his arm around her shoulders and drawing her close again]
Materialistic, too? I'm sorry. I hate to think I've spoiled your Christmas.
Oh, no, you haven't. I supposed I really should be thanking you.

[whispering]
You don't have to do that, but you know what I wish you would do. I wish you would send this Newspickle about his business and concentrate on me instead.

[turing her back to him]
I can't, you already have someone.

[kissing her neck]
Oh, no, not yet.

[stammering]
Mr. Larkin...
After all it is Christmas.
I know, but...

[pulling her close]
Oh, Veronica, I love you so! Won't you open box 237 and take me out of my envelope?

[turns to face]
Box 23- box 237! You mean... You?
Dear Friend. Are you disappointed?
Psychologically, I'm very confused, but personally I feel just wonderful.
Did you find him attractive?
Yes, I thought so. But don't you go changing him. Don't put him on any diets.
Would you say he was fat?
Personally I like that little tummy of his. Gives him a nice homey look. And as for his being bald...
Bald!

I don't think anyone would notice. The way he lets those few hairs in the back grow long and combs them up over his head, coming down behind his ears. It's ingenius really. And after all, that's what you want in a husband isn't it?

[in a daze]
Yes, that's what I want.

[singing]
When they look at me, my heart begins to float / Then it starts a rockin' like a motor boat / Oh! Oh! I never knew any boy like you.
